Message_Text: I'm baking Dad's birthday cake, but I heard there was a recall? Can you check for me? I don't know if I can use my flour
Option_A: If the bag says GH-404, don't use it, okay?
Reaction_A: I just checked. It says GH-402, so I guess it's fine
Option_B: They say it's only a packaging thing, don't worry. What cake is it?
Reaction_B: Lemon pie. I'll save you a slice

Message_Text: Dad just got home. He looks exhausted. He said the hospital was a mess today, the flu this year is so bad.
Option_A: Yeah, I heard! There was a riot, it sounds crazy
Reaction_A: A riot?? This is awful. All because of a flu season?
Option_B: There was a disturbance, I think? Nothing major, they got it under control.
Reaction_B: Your poor Dad. And on his birthday!

Message_Text: Dad loved the cake, but he's not feeling well. He went to bed to rest for a bit... I'm worried.
Option_A: Mom, don't hover. Let him rest
Reaction_A: I'm not hovering! I'm just worried. But okay.
Option_B: Maybe he got the flu as well?
Reaction_B: Oh no... I hope he's just tired.

Message_Text: I'm going to the pharmacy to get Dad some meds. He's acting really weird, just staring at the lamp and mumbling
Option_A: Mom... I don't think it's the flu. Don't go. Lock the bedroom door right now.
Reaction_A: You're scaring me. But... okay. He'll go to sleep soon anyway. He'll be fine in the morning.
Option_B: Okay, but be careful and come right back!
Reaction_B: Okay, grabbing my keys. I'll talk to you later.

Message_Text: Babe it's unreal, the shelves are empty everywhere. Can you check if SuperMart is still open?
Option_A: Yeah, if you'll hurry you'll make it before they close
Reaction_A: Never mind, there were like 3 police cars in the parking lot. Gonna keep looking
Option_B: No, don't go! People are fighting over there. Find another place
Reaction_B: Damn, people are being crazy. I'll keep searching

Message_Text: I'm at another store, found a bag of rice! And it looks like a safe one!
Option_A: Okay, just as long as it's not "Golden Harvest"
Reaction_A: No no, it's fine. They recalled those products.
Option_B: Did you check the bottom of the bag? To be sure?
Reaction_B: There was a stamp, GH-404. Like the recalled lot. That's a shitty move

Message_Text: Mike says there's a riot at the hospital. His sister's working there, he's going to see if she's okay. I'm gonna tag along
Option_A: Absolutely not, are you for real?? Go home!
Reaction_A: Okay, chill! I just wanted to help
Option_B: Okay, just be careful. We don't know what going on
Reaction_B: Alright, I'll stick close to him. Don't worry. Gonna get home soon, and we'll head out.

Message_Text: Finally got home. Mike is on his way, he's freaked out. He sounds really weird on the phone
Option_A: No, do not let him in! You can't trust anyone!
Reaction_A: Well, if you're really sure about it... I'm kinda scared Love.
Option_B: Omg poor Mike. I hope he's okay. You guys should be together, It's safer
Reaction_B: Yeah, you're right. But he was supposed to be here by now... Weird.

Message_Text: Ugh, my timeline is full of conspiracy trash. "Microwave your phone"? People are dumb.
Option_A: I read about it! It makes sense actuelly
Reaction_A: Wait, really? Girl, are you serious? I was sure it's just people trolling again
Option_B: Yeah, don't mind those people.
Reaction_B: Yeah but it's dangerous! Someone's gonna blow up their kitchen.

Message_Text: My lab partner is being weird again. He's just staring at the light and mumbling.
Option_A: What?? He might be sick! Get away from him!!
Reaction_A: What?? are you fr? I'm out of here
Option_B: Omg he's probably high AGAIN
Reaction_B: Ew, you're right. I'm so tired of him

Message_Text: Did you see those photos of the National Guard? What's going on?
Option_A: It's just some old footage. Don't believe everything you see online.
Reaction_A: Can't believe I fell for it
Option_B: So weird, right?? they def hiding something
Reaction_B: You're scaring the shit out of me

Message_Text: I'm heading home. I'm kinda scared being here alone... Maybe I should head to my parent's place
Option_A: Good idea, don't be alone right now. It's really not safe
Reaction_A: I'm gonna head out soon. Talk to you later
Option_B: No, stay put. The roads are a mess and it's really dangerous to travel
Reaction_B: Okay... I'll stay. I'm nervous.

Message_Text: I haven't slept all night. Dad has been standing at the bedroom door for hours... Just breathing. I'm calling 911.
Option_A: They're not going to answer. Put something heavy in front the door first
Reaction_A: Okay... I pushed the dresser there. How are they not answering? What are we going to do?
Option_B: Good, there are "Safety Corridors" for the ambulances, they'll get to you fast
Reaction_B: Therse no answer... We are all alone.

Message_Text: Mrs. Gable next door... she's doing it too. Standing in her yard. Staring at the sun.
Option_A: Is she moving?
Reaction_A: No. She's frozen. Her eyes must be burning.
Option_B: Don't look at her. Close the blinds.
Reaction_B: I'm trying, but my hands are shaking so much.

Message_Text: The power just went off, it's pitch black in here. I hear your Dad... he's saying weird things. About something that's going to get him.
Option_A: Find a weapon RIGHT NOW. Anything heavy.
Reaction_A: I have a heavy lamp. I'm holding it. I can't do it. I can't
Option_B: As long as there is something heavy blocking the door, you are going to be okay. We'll get him help soon.
Reaction_B: Yes. You're right. He can't get out.

Message_Text: He's calling my name. But his voice sounds wrong. He asks me to let him out... He says he's cold.
Option_A: That's not him. Don't listen. We're going to get him help soon. Just remember it.
Reaction_A: It sounds exactly like him though. It breaks my heart. But he'll be okay. We'll be okay.
Option_B: It's a trick! The infected mimic people! Don't open the door!!
Reaction_B: That's insane. It sounds just like him... I can't handle it

Message_Text: I woke up with a killer headache. And the power is out. You okay?
Option_A: I'm fine. I read about those "Power Pauses". That's bullshit, they're lying to us
Reaction_A: Yeah. Saw it before the signal got weak. "Saving lives" my ass.
Option_B: Yeah, there are "Power Pauses" to save power for the hospitals.
Reaction_B: Yeah, I heard about it. No choice but sit in the dark I guess

Message_Text: I'm looking out the window, and there are people just standing in the street. Not moving.
Option_A: Don't look Babe. Seriously, just stay inside, and it'll all be over soon.
Reaction_A: You're right. Nothing I can do right now.
Option_B: Those people are infected. From the grain, from the flu, I don't care. Just don't let them see you.
Reaction_B: I'm ducking down. I saw Gary the Mailman there

Message_Text: I'm starving. I didn't eat anything yesterday with everything that happened. What should I eat?
Option_A: Avoid anything grain-related. Just to be safe.
Reaction_A: Okay... I guess I can eat the ice cream from the back of the freezer
Option_B: As long as it's not "Golden Harvest" products, you're good.
Reaction_B: Good, I have this pasta from another brand

Message_Text: Someone is banging on the front door asking for help. It sounds like a woman.
Option_A: Just wait a sec. Maybe someone else will help?
Reaction_A: Yeah... someone next door just let her in. She'll be safe there.
Option_B: Do not open it. We can't trust anyone right now.
Reaction_B: She sounds hurt though. But I know, I can't risk it.

Message_Text: I slept in the library. The university is on lockdown and I couldn't get out. My neck hurts
Option_A: Are you alone there?
Reaction_A: No, there are some other students here. Some of them look weird
Option_B: Can you sneak out?
Reaction_B: I'm scared to move. The floor is squeaky.

Message_Text: I see Rebbeca from Data Structures! She looks okay!
Option_A: No! You can't trust anyone! Get out of there!
Reaction_A: Okay, fine, I'm going. I don't know where. I don't know what to do.
Option_B: Go to her!
Reaction_B: I'm with her now. It feels so good not to be alone anymore.

Message_Text: I'm so thirsty. There's a water fountain nearby, but some of the "Frozen" are there.
Option_A: Crawl. Go slow.
Reaction_A: Okay. I'm under the desks. I'm shaking.
Option_B: Don't risk it. Stay hidden.
Reaction_B: I feel dizzy. I need water.

Message_Text: I hear someone running, it's coming closer! What do I do??
Option_A: Hide! Now! There's no way out, so you've got to hide!
Reaction_A: I'm in the supply closet. I think I hear footsteps. I love you.
Option_B: Go outside! Some students got out of the university! Find a way out!
Reaction_B: I'm going for it. I love you. Stay safe.

Message_Text: Mrs. Gable's house is on fire... I think it's getting closer!
Option_A: What?? You have to get out!
Reaction_A: Dad is still locked in the bedroom! I can't leave him!
Option_B: The fire won't get to the house, just close the windows!
Reaction_B: No, I have to get out, but what about your Dad??

Message_Text: I'm standing at his door. It's silent inside. Maybe he passed out?
Option_A: Okay, okay, listen to me. Unlock the door, and run. Don't check on him, just RUN
Reaction_A: Okay. I'm doing it.
Option_B: Mom, please, please listen to me. You have to leave right now.
Reaction_B: I can't just let him die!

Message_Text: I opened it and ran. I don't know if he's okay. I just... I just ran.
Option_A: Don't stop running! Don't stop!
Reaction_A: I don't know where to go!
Option_B: Okay Mom. That's okay. You're gonna be okay.
Reaction_B: I'm so sorry.

Message_Text: What do I do? Where do I go?
Option_A: Get to the stadium, it's supposed to be safe there
Reaction_A: Okay, I'm on my way there. I'm going to make it. I love you.
Option_B: Mom, you have to trust me. Go to the sewer. There's a way out.
Reaction_B: Okay. The sewer. I'm going to make it. I love you.

Message_Text: The neighbor's apartment... I hear glass breaking. Screaming.
Option_A: Make sure the deadbolt is locked
Reaction_A: Someone is in the hallway. I hear footsteps
Option_B: Barricade the door, the lock won't stop them!
Reaction_B: I pushed the fridge. I'm so hungry. I don't feel so good

Message_Text: I have nothing left to eat. I found a bag of rice at the back of the cupboard... It's unmarked.
Option_A: Just drink more water, okay? Please don't touch the rice. Promise me.
Reaction_A: Okay... Okay. You're right.
Option_B: DO NOT EAT IT! Hold on just a little bit longer!
Reaction_B: I'll die anyway! I won't be able to fight them off!

Message_Text: My battery is about to run out. Remember I love you, okay?
Option_A: I love you too. We'll be okay.
Reaction_A: Yeah, we will.
Option_B: Don't say stuff like that!! It sounds like goodbye!

Message_Text: I can't stay here. I hear them lurking upstairs. I... I have a plan. I'll go through the sewer system.
Option_A: What?? No, that's crazy! Just hold on. Help will come. It's too dangerous down there.
Reaction_A: okay u right .just a crazy idea. 1%. talk to u later
Option_B: Go now. Before they find you there
Reaction_B: going. love u. 1%. talk to u later

Message_Text: I made it out... alone. I slept in a dumpster... It smells like garbage but I'm alive.
Option_A: Won't be the first time I find you in a dumpster lol
Reaction_A: Haha, very funny!

Message_Text: I see a bus! It says "Rescue Team". Soldiers are waving people in!
Option_A: Omg, finally!

Option_B: Wait, just watch for a sec before you go... Just to be sure.

Message_Text: The soldiers aren't checking for ID. They are scanning eyes with a flashlight.
Option_A: They are checking to see if you're sick
Reaction_A: Yeah, of course. I didn't think
Option_B: What happens if you fail?

Message_Text: I hear screaming... It's getting closer. I have to decide, what do I do?
Option_A: Go to the bus! Before they leave!
Reaction_A: Okay, I'm running. Talk to you soon.
Option_B: I think you should run. You can't trust them. You can't trust anyone.
Reaction_B: But... I just want this to end. Please, make it end. I'm heading north. I'll talk to you soon.

Option_A: Mom? Is everything okay?
Option_B: Hi, how did you guys sleep? How's Dad?

Option_A: Hi, are you still hiding? How are you?
